info.name: Cerebellum, vermal zone
info.description: The vermal zone of the cerebellum is involved with the regulation of posture and stereotyped movements such as walking.  Its major outputs project to the vestibular nuclei and the reticular formation both directly and via connections in the fastigial nuclei of the cerebellum.  These connections allow the cerebellum to influence lower motor neurons in the spinal cord via the vestibulospinal and reticulospinal tracts.
